runcharter 0.0.0.9000

    • How to create multiple runcharts

Create run chart with highlighted improvements where applicable

Source: R/runcharter.R
runcharter.Rd

This will plot the original dataframe, with highlighted runs of improvement. It will also return a dataframe showing the improvment data

runcharter(df, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9, chart_title = NULL,
  chart_subtitle = NULL, direction = "below", faceted = TRUE,
  facet_cols = NULL, save_plot = FALSE, plot_extension = "png", ...)

Arguments

df

dataframe containing columns "date", "y", "grp"
med_rows

the number of rows you wish to base the initial median calculation over
runlength

how long a run of consecutive points should be before re-basing the median
chart_title

title for the final chart
chart_subtitle

subtitle for chart
direction

look for runs "below" or "above" the median
faceted

if you dont need a faceted / trellis display set this to FALSE
facet_cols

the number of columns required for a faceted plot. Ignored if faceted is set to FALSE
save_plot

should the plot be saved? Calls ggsave on the last plot, saving in the current directory, if TRUE.
plot_extension

one of "png","pdf" or other valid extension for saving ggplot2 plots. Used in the call to ggsave.
...

further arguments passed on to function

Value

runchart and a dataframe showing sustained run data if appropriate

Examples

runcharter(data, med_rows = 13, runlength = 9, chart_title = "Automated runs analysis",
direction = "above", faceted = FALSE)
#> Error in UseMethod("arrange_"): no applicable method for 'arrange_' applied to an object of class "function"
